remarks: A function maps to a class to which all values belong.  This version of ~ ffnfv uses bound-variable hypotheses instead of distinct variable conditions.  (Contributed by NM, 28-Sep-2006.)
statement:
ffnfvf.1 $e |- F/_ x A $.
ffnfvf.2 $e |- F/_ x B $.
ffnfvf.3 $e |- F/_ x F $.
ffnfvf $p |- ( F : A --> B <-> ( F Fn A /\ A. x e. A ( F ` x ) e. B ) ) $.
